intro: Alnus tinctoria var. microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf red alder, is a variant of the red alder native to western North America. It is a small to medium-sized deciduous tree or shrub, typically growing to a height of 3–10 meters. The leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptic to ovate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers in catkins, followed by winged fruits that are dispersed by wind. This plant is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and wetlands.
